title: American Horror Story creator Ryan Murphy is writing a miniseries for Billie Lourd
text:
American Horror Story creator Ryan Murphy revealed on Wednesday that he is writing a miniseries for Billie Lourd as a 'tribute to her talent.'

The showrunner, 53, may have already helmed Pose, The Politician and American Horror Story: 1984 this year but he's already got plans to make a new show especially for the actress, 27, because of how 'inspiring' her performances are.

Speaking to Entertainment Weekly about his favourite episodes of American Horror Story, when he said of the Star Wars: The Last Jedi star: 'I love how unhinged and brilliant Billie Lourd is, she just keeps proving to me how talented she is.

Wow! American Horror Story creator Ryan Murphy revealed on Wednesday that he is writing a miniseries for Billie Lourd as a 'tribute to her talent' as he gushed about her performances

'I’ve been so inspired by her performance, I’m writing a miniseries just for her! Top secret but it’s gonna be my tribute to her talent.'

Billie has been a part of the AHS family since season seven, Cult, and also played a major role in season eight, Apocalypse, as witch Mallory, and in 1984 she portrays Montana Duke.

Ryan named Cult as his favourite season of the show, as he gushed that Billie's performance as Winter Anderson left him feeling 'stunned.'

High praise: Of Billie, Ryan claimed he's 'been so inspired by her performance, I’m writing a miniseries just for her! Top secret but its going to be my tribute to her talent'

Of the new season, Ryan also claimed that he loves 'Emma [Roberts] being the good girl for a change in my world, how understated and elegant she is.'

AHS: 1984 follows a group of young Los Angeles men and women who decide to go to the doomed Camp Redwood, where they are set to be counsellors for the happy campers when they arrive.

However, the night before the camp is due to open, the camp employees must do all they can to survive as they're hunted by infamous serial killers Mr. Jingles and the Night Stalker.

Billie and Emma are joined by new series regulars Cody Fern, Leslie Grossman and Angelica Ross to make the show's youngest cast yet.

Also starring in the series are John Carroll Lynch, Matthew Morrison, Gus Kenworthy, DeRon Horton and Zach Villa.

AHS mainstays Evan Peters, who has appeared in every series in the past, did not return for this season, and Sarah Paulson is set to return in a small role.
